segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 7
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 7

segments.pli: 5. Mahāyaññavagga
segments.en: 5. A Great Sacrifice

segments.pli: 52. Dānamahapphalasutta
segments.en: 52. A Very Fruitful Gift

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā Lotus Pond.

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā campeyyakā upāsakā yena āyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho campeyyakā upāsakā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then several lay followers of Campā went to Venerable Sāriputta, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “cirassutā no, bhante, bhagavato sammukhā dhammīkathā.
segments.en: “Sir, it’s been a long time since we’ve heard a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.

segments.pli: Sādhu mayaṃ, bhante, labheyyāma bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā”ti.
segments.en: It would be good if we got to hear a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Tenahāvuso, tadahuposathe āgaccheyyātha,
segments.en: “Well then, reverends, come on the next sabbath day.

segments.pli: appeva nāma labheyyātha bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā”ti.
segments.en: Hopefully you’ll get to hear a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho campeyyakā upāsakā āyasmato sāriputtassa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkamiṃsu.
segments.en: “Yes, sir” they replied. Then they rose from their seats, bowed to Sāriputta, and respectfully circled him before leaving.

segments.pli: Atha kho campeyyakā upāsakā tadahuposathe yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
segments.en: Then on the next sabbath the lay followers of Campā went to Venerable Sāriputta, bowed, and stood to one side.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto tehi campeyyakehi upāsakehi saddhiṃ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then they went together with Sāriputta to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. Sāriputta said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Siyā nu kho, bhante, idhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ na mahapphalaṃ hoti na mahānisaṃsaṃ;
segments.en: “Sir, could it be that someone gives a gift and it is not very fruitful or beneficial,

segments.pli: siyā pana, bhante, idhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mahānisaṃsan”ti?
segments.en: while someone else gives exactly the same gift and it is very fruitful and beneficial?”

segments.pli: “Siyā, sāriputta, idhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ na mahapphalaṃ hoti na mahānisaṃsaṃ;
segments.en: “Indeed it could, Sāriputta.”

segments.pli: siyā pana, sāriputta, idhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mahānisaṃsan”ti.
“Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena midhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ na mahapphalaṃ hoti na mahānisaṃsaṃ;
segments.en: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason for this?”

segments.pli: ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena midhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mahānisaṃsan”ti?
“Idha, sāriputta, ekacco sāpekho dānaṃ deti, patibaddhacitto dānaṃ deti, sannidhipekho dānaṃ deti, ‘imaṃ pecca paribhuñjissāmī’ti dānaṃ deti.
segments.en: “Sāriputta, take the case of a someone who gives a gift as an investment, their mind tied to it, expecting to keep it, thinking ‘I’ll enjoy this in my next life’.

segments.pli: So taṃ dānaṃ deti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: They give to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sāriputta, dadeyya idhekacco evarūpaṃ dānan”ti?
segments.en: What do you think, Sāriputta, don’t some people give gifts in this way?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Tatra, sāriputta, yvāyaṃ sāpekho dānaṃ deti, patibaddhacitto dānaṃ deti, sannidhipekho dānaṃ deti, ‘imaṃ pecca paribhuñjissāmī’ti dānaṃ deti.
segments.en: “Sāriputta, someone who gives a gift as an investment,

segments.pli: So taṃ dānaṃ datvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of the Four Great Kings.

segments.pli: So taṃ kammaṃ khepetvā taṃ iddhiṃ taṃ yasaṃ taṃ ādhipaccaṃ āgāmī hoti āgantā itthattaṃ. (1)
segments.en: When that deed, success, fame, and sovereignty is spent they return to this state of existence.

segments.pli: Idha pana, sāriputta, ekacco na heva kho sāpekho dānaṃ deti, na patibaddhacitto dānaṃ deti, na sannidhipekho dānaṃ deti, na ‘imaṃ pecca paribhuñjissāmī’ti dānaṃ deti;
segments.en: Next, take the case of a someone who gives a gift not as an investment, their mind not tied to it, not expecting to keep it, and not thinking, ‘I’ll enjoy this in my next life’.

segments.pli: api ca kho ‘sāhu dānan’ti dānaṃ deti … pe …. (2)
segments.en: But they give a gift thinking, ‘It’s good to give’ …

segments.pli: Napi ‘sāhu dānan’ti dānaṃ deti;
api ca kho ‘dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ pitupitāmahehi na arahāmi porāṇaṃ kulavaṃsaṃ hāpetun’ti dānaṃ deti … pe …. (3)
segments.en: They give a gift thinking, ‘Giving was practiced by my father and my father’s father. It would not be right for me to abandon this family tradition.’ …

segments.pli: Napi ‘dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ pitupitāmahehi na arahāmi porāṇaṃ kulavaṃsaṃ hāpetun’ti dānaṃ deti;
api ca kho ‘ahaṃ pacāmi, ime na pacanti, nārahāmi pacanto apacantānaṃ dānaṃ adātun’ti dānaṃ deti … pe …. (4)
segments.en: They give a gift thinking, ‘I cook, they don’t. It wouldn’t be right for me to not give to them.’ …

segments.pli: Napi ‘ahaṃ pacāmi, ime na pacanti, nārahāmi pacanto apacantānaṃ dānaṃ adātun’ti dānaṃ deti;
api ca kho ‘yathā tesaṃ pubbakānaṃ isīnaṃ tāni mahāyaññāni ahesuṃ, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: They give a gift thinking, ‘The brahmin hermits of the past were Aṭṭhaka, Vāmaka, Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta, Yamadaggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, and Bhagu.

segments.pli: aṭṭhakassa vāmakassa vāmadevassa vessāmittassa yamadaggino aṅgīrasassa bhāradvājassa vāseṭṭhassa kassapassa bhaguno, evaṃ me ayaṃ dānasaṃvibhāgo bhavissatī’ti dānaṃ deti … pe …. (5)
segments.en: Just as they performed great sacrifices, I will share a gift.’ …

segments.pli: Napi ‘yathā tesaṃ pubbakānaṃ isīnaṃ tāni mahāyaññāni ahesuṃ, seyyathidaṃ—
aṭṭhakassa vāmakassa vāmadevassa vessāmittassa yamadaggino aṅgīrasassa bhāradvājassa vāseṭṭhassa kassapassa bhaguno, evaṃ me ayaṃ dānasaṃvibhāgo bhavissatī’ti dānaṃ deti;
api ca kho ‘imaṃ me dānaṃ dadato cittaṃ pasīdati, attamanatā somanassaṃ upajāyatī’ti dānaṃ deti … pe …. (6)
segments.en: They give a gift thinking, ‘When giving this gift my mind becomes clear, and I become happy and joyful.’ …

segments.pli: Napi ‘imaṃ me dānaṃ dadato cittaṃ pasīdati, attamanatā somanassaṃ upajāyatī’ti dānaṃ deti;
segments.en: They don’t give a gift thinking, ‘When giving this gift my mind becomes clear, and I become happy and joyful.’

segments.pli: api ca kho cittālaṅkāracittaparikkhāraṃ dānaṃ deti.
segments.en: But they give a gift thinking, ‘This is an adornment and requisite for the mind.’

segments.pli: So taṃ dānaṃ deti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: They give to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.

segments.pli: Taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sāriputta, dadeyya idhekacco evarūpaṃ dānan”ti?
segments.en: What do you think, Sāriputta, don’t some people give gifts in this way?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Tatra, sāriputta, yvāyaṃ na heva sāpekho dānaṃ deti;
segments.en: “Sāriputta, someone who gives gifts, not for any other reason,

segments.pli: na patibaddhacitto dānaṃ deti;
na sannidhipekho dānaṃ deti;
na ‘imaṃ pecca paribhuñjissāmī’ti dānaṃ deti;
napi ‘sāhu dānan’ti dānaṃ deti;
napi ‘dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ pitupitāmahehi na arahāmi porāṇaṃ kulavaṃsaṃ hāpetun’ti dānaṃ deti;
napi ‘ahaṃ pacāmi, ime na pacanti, nārahāmi pacanto apacantānaṃ dānaṃ adātun’ti dānaṃ deti;
napi ‘yathā tesaṃ pubbakānaṃ isīnaṃ tāni mahāyaññāni ahesuṃ, seyyathidaṃ—
aṭṭhakassa vāmakassa vāmadevassa vessāmittassa yamadaggino aṅgīrasassa bhāradvājassa vāseṭṭhassa kassapassa bhaguno, evaṃ me ayaṃ dānasaṃvibhāgo bhavissatī’ti dānaṃ deti;
napi ‘imaṃ me dānaṃ dadato cittaṃ pasīdati, attamanatā somanassaṃ upajāyatī’ti dānaṃ deti;
api ca kho cittālaṅkāracittaparikkhāraṃ dānaṃ deti.
segments.en: but thinking, ‘This is an adornment and requisite for the mind’,

segments.pli: So taṃ dānaṃ datvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn among the gods of Brahmā’s Host.

segments.pli: So taṃ kammaṃ khepetvā taṃ iddhiṃ taṃ yasaṃ taṃ ādhipaccaṃ anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthattaṃ. (7)
segments.en: When that deed, success, fame, and sovereignty is spent they are a non-returner; they do not return to this state of existence.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, sāriputta, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena midhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ na mahapphalaṃ hoti na mahānisaṃsaṃ.
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone gives a gift and it is not very fruitful or beneficial,

segments.pli: Ayaṃ pana, sāriputta, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena midhekaccassa tādisaṃyeva dānaṃ dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mahānisaṃsan”ti.
segments.en: while someone else gives exactly the same gift and it is very fruitful and beneficial.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā…

suttaplex.blurb: The lay followers of Campā seek a teaching from the Buddha. Together with Sāriputta, they ask the Buddha about what makes a gift fruitful.
